verses.roman:
mayaś ca mocito vahneḥ
sabhāṁ sakhya upāharat
yasmin duryodhanasyāsīj
jala-sthala-dṛśi-bhramaḥ

synonyms: mayaḥ—the demon named Maya; ca—and; mocitaḥ—delivered; vahneḥ—from the fire; sabhām—an assembly hall; sakhye—to his friend, Arjuna; upāharat—presented; yasmin—in which; duryodhanasya—of Duryodhana; āsīt—there was; jala—of water; sthala—and dry ground; dṛśi—in seeing; bhramaḥ—confusion.
translation: When the demon Maya was saved from the fire by his friend Arjuna, Maya presented him with an assembly hall, in which Duryodhana would later mistake water for a solid floor.
